main event: On February 20, 1961, an unidentified airborne object was observed near Fort Washakie, Wyoming.
interesting points: The object was determined not to be a conventional aircraft or satellite., Reported by witnesses who saw the object hovering at a low altitude., The object was described as approximately 40 to 50 feet in diameter., Witnesses claimed the object was a dull silver color and had no visible signs of appendages., The observation lasted about 10 to 15 minutes before the object shot straight up into the sky.
witness description: The witnesses include Mr. Harold and possibly two others, all of whom reported seeing the object together.
